post_text:
School Update: Important Information

At the September 14th Board Meeting, the BCPS School Board approved the extension of the predominately remote/virtual learning model for the remainder of the first semester. We are offering opportunities for vulnerable groups of students to receive in-person instruction. We will examine the data during the months of October, November, and December to make a determination regarding the second semester.

As a reminder, if your child is having difficulty with internet access at home, the BCPS Guest Network is available 7 days a week at all five school locations from 8AM - 8PM. In addition, you may bring your child to the BCPS Internet Cafe' during select hours to allow him/her to watch instructional videos and complete assignments. We have two locations available throughout the division:

Location One: Brunswick High School | Time: 9:00 AM - 12 Noon

Location Two: J.S. Russell Middle School | Time: 2:00 PM - 7:00 PM

As always, thank you for your patience.

The BCPS Technology Department will offer on-site technology support at the Brunswick High School on Tuesday, September 22, 2020, from 9:00 AM - 3:00 PM

All parents and students will be required to wear a mask and be screened. The sessions are by appointment only. To schedule your appointment, please call 434-848-3138 ex. 4026.

We ask that you please bring the student device, mobile hotspot, and student login information for your troubleshooting needs.
If you are unable to schedule an appointment, please call 434-848-3138 ex. 4024 for a phone support call back.

Please note that we are experiencing higher than normal call volumes. There may be a delay in responsiveness. We appreciate your patience during this time.

post_text:
Week of Sept. 21-25 BCPS Meal Pick-Up/Delivery Registration

Please complete this electronic form by Thursday, Sept. 17 at 8:00 am. Please submit one form for each student. We need the information below to ensure that we can properly prepare the meals that you deserve. As a suggestion, please select the pick-up location closest to you. Please note that if you have more than one child attending separate schools, you can pick up all meals from one location to avoid additional travel. If you select meal delivery, please make sure someone will be available to receive the meals between 11:00 a.m. and 2:00 p.m. each day. Completion of this form gives us permission to deliver the meals to your house if you select meal delivery.

**Please note that meals are for registered Brunswick County Public School students and Head Start students only.

Click here to complete the form -> https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeRki9OsS51S9P-wHa2cQ_3ootn-sr11-dgCnqcrRhNSS69WQ/viewform

Brunswick High School
September 11 at 11:08 PM ·

BHS 9/11 Virtual Commemoration Ceremony

The students, faculty and staff, along with the administration attended a virtual field trip to the 911 Memorial Museum and participated in a live stream ceremony honoring the victims of 9/11. Throughout the day, students were engaged in reflection activities via Pear Deck and project-based assignments posted in Google Classroom.
#BrunswickStrong

post_text:
🚨🚨Important Message: Students attending Brunswick High School and J.S. Russell Middle School may receive an error message when logging into ZOOM this morning. Please be advised that ZOOM is currently experiencing a national system outage. This outage is not just specific to our division, but to many entities/companies with ZOOM accounts. We have contacted the company and they will provide an update when services are restored. At that time, we will post a follow-up message.

In the meantime, students may work on additional work via their Google Classroom. We apologize for the delay and appreciate your patience as we work to resolve this issue.

post_text:
Community Spotlight: The Lawrenceville Rotary Club presented Brunswick County Public schools with a donation on behalf of Empire Beauty of 800 children’s mask.

Empire Beauty owners, Katherine and Al Overholt utilized the Lawrenceville Rotary Club to make the presentation on their behalf. The donation included 500 disposable children’s masks and 300 children’s cloth masks in response to the pandemic, COVID-19, and ensuring the safety of students in our communities upon returning to school. The Lawrenceville Rotary Club President, Ms. Dixie Walker made the presentation to Dr. Kristy Somerville-Midgette, Superintendent of Brunswick County Public Schools during Rotary’s program luncheon on Thursday, August 20th. “ #BrunswickStrong

August 13 at 3:54 PM ·

Russell Middle School received a massive donation of novels from the Virginia Cooperative Extension. VCE / 4H is our local community connection to the state's two land grant universities Virginia Tech and Virginia State.

4H is an important school partner and this donation is an example of their collaboration with BCPS to help our students succeed. Our students will use the books to support our goal of improving our reading levels.

Thank you!!!

post_text:
On Monday, August 3, 2020, Dr. Kristy Somerville-Midgette and the Brunswick County School Board welcomed the faculty and staff to the 2020-21 academic year at our virtual convocation. This year’s theme was “The Promise: Redesigning our Commitment.”

Our keynote speaker, Maureen G. Mulvaney, MGM, provided a high energy kickstart for the school year. We received greetings from the BCPS Board Chair, the Brunswick County Board of Supervisors, and our Division Superintendent.

At the conclusion of convocation, employees were given an opportunity to win a door prize by building/department and our 2020 BCPS Brunswick Strong and BCPS Rising Star Award Recipients were announced.

BCPS Brunswick Strong Award Recipient | Mr. Darrick Summiel (RMS)
BCPS Rising Star Award Recipient | Ms. Charnese McPherson (MP)

post_text:
This message is in reference to the deployment of devices and hotspots for Russell Middle School. Day two of deployment is tomorrow, Wednesday, August 5, 2020. The deployment will take place at the Brunswick High School Gymnasium. Please know that we do anticipate delays as this is the first time we have deployed this quantity of devices. Initially, we thought that this process would take at least 15-20 minutes per student; however, we notice that it takes at least 30 minutes or more per student after they have entered the gymnasium. The increased time is due to the volume of individuals who arrive for device pickup at the same time. In addition, delays can be attributed to ensuring that all students understand how to login- to his or her device along with connecting any mobile hotspots by request.

As a friendly reminder, we have two available times for tomorrow, 9am-12pm and 3pm-7pm. Again, we appreciate your patience as we navigate this process.

shared_text:
Totaro Elementary School
July 29 at 9:17 PM ·

Although our custodial staff has always kept Totaro clean, during this pandemic they have stepped up to the challenge of thoroughly disinfecting and cleaning our school throughout the day. They have also posted social distancing markers. Today we celebrated their outstanding performance with a pizza party for lunch.

Even though we are starting school virtually, we are ready and excited for the return of our students. Our office staff, custodians, and administrators collaborated to ensure that Totaro is prepared by increasing safety measures.
#WeCHOOSEBetter

post_text:
Dear Brunswick Families,
Effective, July 28, 2020, with guidance from the VDH, we plan to move forward with the virtual option only for the first 9-weeks of the 2020-21 academic year. As we move forward for the reopening and the start of the academic year, August 10, 2020, we will begin school using a full virtual model for the first 9-weeks. Therefore, if you selected the hybrid model for your student(s), then you will be switched to virtual for at least the first 9-weeks. The School Board and Administration will continue to monitor the impact of COVID-19 on Brunswick County Public Schools and make a determination of delivery model(s) for the 2nd 9-weeks and beyond. Please see the attached letter for details. We thank you for your continued flexibility as we navigate these unprecedented times.

Please see the letter below from our division superintendent, Dr. Kristy Somerville-Midgette.
text:
Dear Brunswick Families,
Effective, July 28, 2020, with guidance from the VDH, we plan to move forward with the virtual option only for the first 9-weeks of the 2020-21 academic year. As we move forward for the reopening and the start of the academic year, August 10, 2020, we will begin school using a full virtual model for the first 9-weeks. Therefore, if you selected the hybrid model for your student(s), then you will be switched to virtual for at least the first 9-weeks. The School Board and Administration will continue to monitor the impact of COVID-19 on Brunswick County Public Schools and make a determination of delivery model(s) for the 2nd 9-weeks and beyond. Please see the attached letter for details. We thank you for your continued flexibility as we navigate these unprecedented times.

Please see the letter below from our division superintendent, Dr. Kristy Somerville-Midgette.

post_text:
Attention Parents and Guardians: Based on guidance from The Virginia Department of Education, it is anticipated that schools will be allowed to open in August under Phase III, but social distancing guidelines will be required. As a result, we are developing our final plan for the 2020-2021 academic school year.

Please take a moment to complete the Academic Year Instructional Delivery Plan Survey.

Survey Link English -> https://forms.gle/kY31Nd6HEji5QakK7

A draft copy of the plan and the survey may be found on our division's website in the News & Announcements section as well as the 2020-2021 Return to School page.

All parents will be required to complete (1) one survey per child enrolled in Brunswick County Public Schools for the 2020-2021 school year. Please do not include multiple children/students in one form.

We value your input and feedback during this critical and important time as we finalize our plans. Therefore, we ask that you complete the survey below by Monday, July 13, 2020, at 8:00 AM.

Brunswick County Public Schools will hold a virtual summer school session from July 6-23, 2020. Do you have a child enrolled in BCPS that was recommended for virtual summer school? We can help!! The division will assign each child attending virtual summer school a Chromebook. A mobile hotspot will be available for students attending the virtual summer school by request only with one (1) per household.

Please view the image below for pick up dates and times. Devices may only be picked up at your child's school. Due to social distancing measures, students and parents will not be allowed to enter the building during pickup.

Parent Survey Alert: Please complete the information below by Tuesday, June 23, 2020, at 8:00 AM.

Background: Based on guidance from The Virginia Department of Education, it is anticipated that schools will be allowed to open in August under Phase III, but social distancing guidelines will be required. As a result, we are considering a plan to stagger students in the buildings and limiting the number of students in each classroom. The number of students on each bus will also be limited. This means that some students at the upper grades may attend school only one day a week and participate virtually the remainder of the week.

At the PreK-3 level, it is our hope to allow them to attend school 3 or 4 days a week, as virtual learning is not as successful at these grade levels. High school students will participate virtually in most classes and only attend school for hands-on CTE or lab classes. Please respond to the questions below. Your input and feedback are critical and important as we finalize these plans.

Survey Form: https://forms.gle/MWMh6sK4fFX4SAwq9

post_text:
The Virginia Department of Education (VDOE) has put together a resource listing that will help you and your child to prioritize your mental wellness. In addition to keeping children physically safe during the pandemic, it is also important to care for their emotional health. The threat of COVID-19, long-term social distancing, and prolonged disruption to the school routine may create significant stress and impact children's mental well-being.

The information below will assist you in navigating this period together in a healthy way.

http://www.doe.virginia.gov/support/prevention/quick-guide-se-wellness-parents.pdf

post_text:
Alumni Spotlight: Congratulations to Mr. Robbie Garnes on being appointed as the Principal of Dinwiddie High School in Dinwiddie, Virginia.

Mr. Garnes is a 1995 graduate of Brunswick Senior High School. Mr. Garnes collegiate career includes a bachelor’s degree in English from Saint Paul’s College and a master’s degree in Educational Leadership and Policy Studies from Virginia Tech.

In unprecedented times such as this, we celebrate with you as you continue to enhance the educational experience of the students at DHS. We wish you much success as you continue your journey of being #BrunswickStrong!!

post_text:
Brunswick 4-H Summer Workshop Series: For the months of May-July, the 4-H program will supply materials to get kids away from the computer to learn about topics in a hands-on way. The workshops will be available for two-week time periods. There will be videos/zoom meetings youth can join and view, but not necessary to complete activities. Most supplies will be provided, but there be a need to use items around your house. There will be a photography contest taking place for each two-week session that you can enter for a chance to win a 4-H prize pack!

You will need to set up a date and time to pick up materials at the Brunswick Extension Office (100-A Tobacco Street, Lawrenceville).

To sign up, call Kayleigh Mize at 434-532-7574 between the hours of 8:30 am- 5:00 pm OR email mizekj@vt.edu. If you do not get an answer, please leave a message.
text:

Congratulations to BHS Seniors Chadwick Cleaton, Jr. and Amya Hicks on being featured in the Virginia Department of Education - VDOE Graduate Together VA 2020 showcase.

As coronavirus has prompted the cancellation of high school graduation ceremonies across the country, partners are coming together to pay tribute to millions of high school seniors, their extraordinary teachers, and their families, as we rally everyone around a message of hope and unity.

Thank you Dr. James Lane for the feature!! ❤️🎓📣

As Teacher Appreciation Week ends, we want to once again thank all of our faculty, staff, and substitute teachers for your continued dedication to our students. Not only have you worked hard to educate them during the traditional school year, you have gone above and beyond during this time to make sure all students are still learning and are emotionally well. It was an honor to present your appreciation gifts carside today. We couldn't ask for a better staff! THANK YOU!!!

BCPS Nutritional Services will prepare the last meal pick-up on Tuesday, May 12, 2020 for the 2019-2020 school year. Please make sure you register for meal pick-up. Staff will verify the names of registered families on that day to ensure prepared meals are delivered to those who registered.

May 1 at 8:15 PM ·

Over the course of the next few weeks, we will share photos of students from the BHS Class of 2020. Essentially, we will post 6-8 graduates per day from the submissions. The submissions will be posted in the order in which they were received. Thank you to all of the graduates that participated in the survey. If you are a member of the Class of 2020, please take a moment to complete the survey and join in the fun. #BrunswickStrong #BHS2020

post_text: It's National School Nurse Day! We're privileged to have the care & skill of Nurse Steed, Nurse Smelley, and Nurse Seward. These amazing ladies take pride in handling things in a calm & reassuring way. We recognize your compassion for our students and staff. From providing band-aids for scrapes to being first responders to medical concerns and guiding our students to healthy lifestyles, we say, Thank You! #BrunswickStrong #SchoolNurseDay
text: It's National School Nurse Day! We're privileged to have the care & skill of Nurse Steed, Nurse Smelley, and Nurse Seward. post_text:
Would you like to celebrate an amazing teacher in honor of Teacher Appreciation Week? With both students and teachers working hard from home, now's your chance to send a digital thank-you note to show your appreciation. Your favorite teacher could win a Virginia vacation and prizes for your school!

Make your favorite teacher smile with a digital thank-you note featuring custom artwork by the three student art contest winners. #BrunswickStrong #ThankATeacher

http://thankateacherva.com

post_text: Teaching is one of the truest, most noble professions to exist. At whatever level you are involved (substitute, retired, administrative, or actively in the classroom), our hearts are filled with gratitude & admiration for all that you do and have done. 💛🍎📚 Thank you to all of the amazing teachers who go above and beyond for our students! #BrunswickStrong #ThankATeacher #TeacherAppreciationWeek

post_text:
🚨Alert: BCPS "NEW" Guest WiFi Network🚨

We are pleased to announce that we now have a guest WiFi network at all five of our school locations.

The new network name is BCPS COVID 19 GUEST and you do not need a password for access.

As we continue our COVID 19 response efforts, please adhere to the state-mandated social distancing rules with no gatherings of 10 or more during on-site access. We encourage you to stay in your vehicles while using this service.

The guest network includes educational content filtering and is available 7 days a week from 8 AM - 8 PM. In an effort to provide the best connectivity possible, guests will not have access to the following: Netflix, Hulu, HBOGo, or any other video streaming sites.

Please refer to the attached images for additional information.

KAINE.SENATE.GOV
Kaine Announces ‘Everybody’s The Graduation Speaker’ Video Contest For Virginia High School Seniors | U.S. Senator Tim Kaine of Virginia

Virginia Department of Education - VDOE
April 27 at 1:01 PM ·

Senator Tim Kaine invites and encourages graduating VA high school seniors to submit video of an original speech they would like to give at graduation for his "Everybody's the Graduation Speaker" contest. Selected videos will feature on his Facebook and website during the months of May and June.

Senator Kaine says, "I look forward to hearing the wisdom Virginia’s future leaders have to offer and sharing their inspiration with others. Let’s show Virginia what the Class of 2020 is all about."

For more information, visit: https://www.kaine.senate.gov/press-releases/kaine-announces-everybodys-the-graduation-speaker-video-contest-for-virginia-high-school-seniors

post_text: On today, April 16th, the first “State of Brunswick County Public Schools” division Zoom webinar was hosted with over 270 participants. While we realize that this is our “New Normal”, we continue to try to adapt to life as we now know it due to COVID-19. The State of BCPS acknowledged the extraordinary efforts that our Brunswick Strong Employees have demonstrated since the closure of schools by Governor Northam on March 13, 2020. Reports were delivered in the areas of the Superintendent’s overview, instruction, pupil personnel, human resources, and technology. There was a question and answer session as well as accolades by participants. Dr. Midgette closed out today’s session with a profound quote by Denis Leary. “Crisis doesn’t create character, it reveals it.” With much support and recognition, we commend the employees of BCPS for epitomizing the true meaning of being #BrunswickStrong.

post_text:
Dear Families,

We know life can become a bit overwhelming when trying to handle the demands of distance learning and deadlines. We are pleased to announce that we now have a division subscription to Remind. Remind is a text reminder application that will allow teachers to periodically send out classroom and school reminders via text message to help take the burden of remembering off of you. In addition, they can share photos with the class of the wonderful things that are happening during this time.

What does this mean? You will have to download the free Remind App. You will not receive advertisement texts, and your phone number will remain private. The teacher will not be able to see your phone number, nor can anyone else. You may opt-out at any time. Our hope is that this will help strengthen the distance learning connection.

Please do not hesitate to contact your child's teacher via email or via the BCPS Homework Hotline if you have any questions.

https://www.remind.com/families

text:
Dear Families,

We know life can become a bit overwhelming when trying to handle the demands of distance learning and deadlines. We are pleased to announce that we now have a division subscription to Remind. Remind is a text reminder application that will allow teachers to periodically send out classroom and school reminders via text message to help take the burden of remembering off of you. In addition, they can share photos with the class of the wonderful things that are happening during this time.

What does this mean? You will have to download the free Remind App. You will not receive advertisement texts, and your phone number will remain private. The teacher will not be able to see your phone number, nor can anyone else. You may opt-out at any time. Our hope is that this will help strengthen the distance learning connection.

Please do not hesitate to contact your child's teacher via email or via the BCPS Homework Hotline if you have any questions.

https://www.remind.com/families

ATTN: Totaro Elementary School Families

Do you need a little extra help with your homework? Call the TES Homework Hotline! Our teachers are available to help you in all academic areas. With skill and patience, teachers offer guidance allowing students to successfully complete their school work via distance learning.

Just dial 434-848-3138 followed by the extension listed below for your child's teacher. A member of the team will return your call.

For additional information, please call Totaro Elementary School at 434-848-3209.

post_text:
🚨Please read this message in its entirety. 🚨

Good Afternoon Brunswick Family,

As we prepare for tomorrow's delivery, families who would like to take advantage of the delivery service where your child drives, is a car rider, or some other means where they are not on a regular bus route, please call the BCPS Meal Hotline 434-848-3138, ext. 4018 and leave your name and number. Someone will call you back today. If requests or concerns are not shared, it is difficult for us to know and plan to meet your needs. Please reach out.

Please also note that the times for the bus deliveries will be posted and ran on the instant alert tomorrow. Please note that the buses will have extended routes due to routes being combined. Please be aware that it will be an extended wait time due to the extra time it will take to hand off materials, instructional packets, and meals.
text:
🚨Please read this message in its entirety. 🚨

Good Afternoon Brunswick Family,

As we prepare for tomorrow's delivery, families who would like to take advantage of the delivery service where your child drives, is a car rider, or some other means where they are not on a regular bus route, please call the BCPS Meal Hotline 434-848-3138, ext. 4018 and leave your name and number. Someone will call you back today. If requests or concerns are not shared, it is difficult for us to know and plan to meet your needs. Please reach out.

Please also note that the times for the bus deliveries will be posted and ran on the instant alert tomorrow. Please note that the buses will have extended routes due to routes being combined. Please be aware that it will be an extended wait time due to the extra time it will take to hand off materials, instructional packets, and meals.

post_text:
Check out this cool resource from Pampa Independent School District.

You can see an animal in your house if you Google search an animal name (on iPhone or android) and then press ‘View in 3D’. It opens your camera and soon will show you the animal moving in your room. You can walk around it and take a picture of it with people. Look for :
Lion
Tiger
Cheetah
Shark
Hedgehog
Duck
Emperor penguin
Wolf
Angler fish
Goat
Rottweiler
Snakes
Eagle
Brown bear
Alligator
Horse
Shetland pony
Macaw
Pug
Turtle
Cat
Octopus
Dog

Share your child’s photo using the hashtag #BrunswickStrong by choosing one of the animals from the list above!! 📸

post_text: “Technology will never replace great teachers, but technology in the hands of great teachers is transformational.” -George Couros #BrunswickStrong #COVIDtheBrunswickway
shared_text:
LD Swann
March 27 at 1:12 PM ·

The doors of the schools may have closed temporarily, but our responsibility and dedication as educators remain unwavering. We are still working to insure that our scholars continue to receive instruction, even from a distance. Great meetings this morning via Zoom with the BHS English Department and with my student teacher Michelle Cummins.
#BrunswickStrong

post_text: #BrunswickStrong 💙🎥📸
shared_text:
Rebecca Councill is with Darlene Brown and 8 others.
March 26 at 8:21 PM ·

🥰So this just happened...not flawlessly, not with everything I had planned, with several “can you hear me”, BUT with lots of smiles!

Eleven participants PLUS ten smiling mamas, daddy’s, big sisters, and a grandma survived my first Zoom Kindergarten meeting! I’ll take that as a 🤩win! Thank you families for your patience and support as I throw all this at you! 😘

#brunswickstrong #realifeonlinelearning #wetried #atleasttheyweresmiling #wegotthisfriends

post_text: Red Oak- Sturgeon Elementary, we can’t wait to see your PANTHER PRIDE!
shared_text:
Red Oak- Sturgeon Elementary
March 24 at 9:51 PM ·

We are all saddened after the Governor's announcement yesterday to close schools for the rest of the year, but we also want everyone to remain healthy and safe! Even though we cannot physically be together, we can still come together in other ways. We would like to put a little fun spirit back in your week by having a virtual spirit week! Take a picture each day and post it in the comments! Wednesday is pajama day; why not since we can have school in our PJs everyday now! Thursday is build a fort day; get out those blankets and get creative...don't forget to read while you're at it! Friday is show and tell; show us something that we never get to see at school like your pet!

post_text: Community Appreciation | This photo was taken at Rickey’s Service Center in Brodnax on today. During our meal delivery efforts, this sweet UPS driver commended the division and the ladies pictured (RMS, Central Office, and Transportation) for going out to deliver meals to our students. As an act of paying it forward, she treated the ladies to lunch. While she thought it befitting to commend our efforts, we also commend the efforts of essential personnel such as herself for working during such a critical time. All in all, it was a great way to spend the day. #BrunswickStrong

We would like to thank our BCPS Family and the greater Brunswick community for their support as we held Operation: BCPS COVID-19 Relief Effort on today. While much of the nation is being impacted by the recent pandemic; we stand together as a division.

With a flipped approach, we will continue to work together in our community by changing a negative into a positive. The “Brunswick Strong” Way of COVID (Creating Opportunities Via Instructional Deliveries). #BrunswickStrong #COVIDtheBrunswickWay

post_text:
🚨Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, Governor Northam announced today his decision to close all public and private schools through the end of the 2019-20 academic year. I know this will lead to a lot of questions and I ask for your patience as we work through this together. The Virginia Department of Education will provide us and all other school divisions in the Commonwealth with guidance for providing foodservice and the continuity of instruction in an equitable manner while schools are closed.

Dr. Lane, State Superintendent, and his office will provide guidance regarding the following:

-Graduation for Seniors

-How to issue standard and verified credits with a focus on differentiated requirements for a 12th grader

-Allow for new instruction

-Ensuring equity for students with disabilities

We thank you for your continued patience as we navigate this pandemic.

Kristy Somerville-Midgette, Ed.D.
Division Superintendent

post_text: Teacher Shared Resource: TumbleBooks is an amazing resource that we would like to share with all of our students. Check out the post below. Would you like to give it a try? Visit www.tumblebooklibrary.com for more information.
shared_text:
Meherrin Regional Library System
March 18 at 4:48 PM ·

TumbleBooks, a world leader in online children's book databases, has graciously provided us with free access to 5 great databases for children, teens, and even adults! Check out the Digital Library section on our website for free access to these databases TODAY! No library card necessary!!

Unlike other databases, you are able to have unlimited access, which means you can read as many books as you want, on any device! There are no check-outs, holds, or downloads, and the books are available instantly!

We will have access through August 31, 2020.

post_text:
🚨 Good afternoon, Please read this message in its entirety.

We recognize that the national news coverage of COVID-19 (coronavirus) raises questions and concerns for our community. A coronavirus is typically spread through coughing or sneezing, much like the flu and other respiratory viruses. Symptoms are thought to appear within 2 to 14 days after exposure and consist of fever, cough, and difficulty breathing. If your child or any family member present with any of the symptoms, please consult your primary care physician.

Brunswick County Public Schools, administrators, and staff have been closely monitoring this developing situation. As there are now eight presumptive positive or confirmed cases in Virginia, I wanted to update you on our efforts regarding the health and safety of students and staff.

A comprehensive parent letter regarding COVID-19, Coronavirus is being sent home with students today. This information has been placed on the division website and social media as well.

Thank you

Kristy N. Somerville-Midgette, Ed.D.
Division Superintendent

post_text: Community Partnerships You Can Count On!! 🤝 💙📚 #BrunswickStrong #SouthsidePride
shared_text:
Totaro Elementary School
March 10 at 3:29 PM ·

Many thanks to Mrs. Vondrenna Smithers and the entire Southside Virginia Community College and Lake Country Advanced Knowledge Center staff for providing new and innovative learning experiences for the 5th grade students of Totaro Elementary School. The exposure and insight offered enables the students to think beyond a traditional career and helps build an understanding of importance for trade skills as well. Along with the tours and hands-on activities, our students are appreciative for the delicious lunch and gifts that you all provided. We are very fortunate to have this collaborative opportunity and look forward to working with you all in the near future! #WeCHOOSEBetter #SVCCPanthers #CollaborationisKey

Meherrin-Powellton Elementary School
March 1 at 9:21 PM ·

Meherrin-Powellton is celebrating Dr. Seuss Week! Please be reminded of the following events:

Monday, March 2, 2020 – “Read Across America Day”
•Students, Faculty, and Staff – Wear Red, White and Blue
• Students will listen to Dr. Seuss books read by invited guests
• Students will receive Dr. Seuss pencils and be served birthday cake flavored ice cream cups

Tuesday, March 3, 2020 – “Green Eggs and Ham Day”
• Students, Faculty, and Staff – Wear Green

Wednesday, 4, 2020 – “The 500 Hats of Bartholomew Cubbins Day”
• Students, Faculty, and Staff – Wear Your Favorite Hat

Thursday, March 5, 2020 – “The Lorax Day” and SCHOOL SPRING PICTURES
• The Lorax and Truffula Trees in the cafeteria
• Movie/Snack: The Lorax
• Students will receive Dr. Seuss Bookmarks
• Dollar Book Cart

Friday, March 6, 2020 - PD Day – No School for Students

Wednesday, March 11, 2020 – Title I Math/Literacy Night
Theme: “One Fish, Two Fish, Red Fish, Blue Fish” This event will be held at Food Lion
Lawrenceville, VA
5:00 P.M. 7:30 P.M.

post_text: #StateBound 💙 #BrunswickStrong
shared_text:
South Hill Enterprise (SHE)
February 28 at 11:56 PM ·

Bulldogs Fall to John Marshall in 2A Regional Final

A Brunswick trey late in the third quarter cut the John Marshall lead to 64-60 but the Bulldogs ran out of gas down the stretch and the top-ranked Justices pulled away for a 97-71 win in the 2A regional title game on Friday night in Richmond. The Bulldogs played a whale of a game for three and a half quarters against one of the top teams in the state, regardless of classification. Both teams will move on to 2A state play starting next Friday with time and opponent to be announced.

shared_text:
Brunswick County Industrial Develop Authority
February 27 at 2:18 PM ·

Students from Brunswick High School who entered essays for the HGTV Essay Contest and town video came out today and toured historic Lawrenceville and learned about the IDA and their projects. It was a great event and the students were very eager to hear about the future businesses coming to Brunswick County. They asked great questions. The overall theme of the letters was the students great love for their town, their desire for things to do and jobs to return too.

Their optimism and community spirit was a great boost to the IDA staff. Thanks Colonel Nhmbure for your leadership of our future leaders.

🚨Delayed Opening Alert | February 26, 2020🚨

We are experiencing dense fog throughout much of the county. As a precaution for safety and visibility, Brunswick County Public Schools will operate on a two-hour delay for all students and staff today, February 26, 2020. post_text:
Brunswick .vs. Greensville | Regional Playoffs

This is a reminder that the Brunswick Bulldogs will play the Greensville County Eagles on Wednesday, February 26, 2020, at 7:00 p.m. The game will be held at the Greensville County High School Gymnasium.

The doors will open at 6:00 p.m. Tickets are $7.00 and will only be sold at the door. Therefore, tickets will not be sold in advance.

You are reminded that no backpacks or large purses are allowed in the gymnasium. We want to ensure that everyone is safe and enjoys the game. As always, we hope to see you all there dressed in your Bulldog Blue! #BrunswickStrong

Possible Early Dismissal Alert | February 20, 2020

Dear Brunswick Family,

Please read this message in its entirety. We are monitoring weather from the National Weather Service and local news outlets to determine the impact of the snowstorm for Thursday, February 20th. At the present moment, we are exploring the option of an early dismissal. We wanted to give families an opportunity to make childcare arrangements if necessary. In addition, drivers please be on standby. We will notify everyone as soon as a decision is made. Thank you.
text:
Possible Early Dismissal Alert | February 20, 2020

Dear Brunswick Family,

Please read this message in its entirety. We are monitoring weather from the National Weather Service and local news outlets to determine the impact of the snowstorm for Thursday, February 20th. At the present moment, we are exploring the option of an early dismissal. We wanted to give families an opportunity to make childcare arrangements if necessary. In addition, drivers please be on standby. We will notify everyone as soon as a decision is made. Thank you.

post_text:
Congratulations to Mrs.Jacqueline Alston!! She was recently featured by Longwood University. During her interview, she shared how easy it was for her to receive the Reading, Literacy, and Learning endorsement from Longwood University. As a full-time teacher, who already had her master's degree, she shared how Longwood was a great choice. The Reading, Literacy, and Learning program allowed her the flexibility to continue working full-time and attend classes part-time. Alston now serves as a Reading Specialist at Red Oak-SturgeonElementary and works with students and teachers to help them overcome challenges. #BrunswickStrong #bcpsva

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QM5oSPTt1M4

post_text:
ALUMNI SPOTLIGHT
"High achievement always takes place in the framework of high expectation." - Charles Kettering

Congratulations to Lt. Marcus Smith on being recognized as the Meherrin River Regional Jail (MRRJ) Supervisor of the Quarter - 4th Quarter 2019 and Supervisor of the Year 2019! As an outstanding employee, it was noted that Lt. Smith exhibits a level of leadership that is superb. As a supervisor, he is a valuable asset to the MRRJ.

Lt. Marcus Smith is a 2007 graduate of Brunswick High School, a 2011 graduate of Saint Paul’s College, and a member of Kappa Alpha Psi Fraternity, Inc. As a native of Brunswick County, we would like to shine a light on Lt. Marcus Smith as he is a true example of what it means to be #BrunswickStrong.

post_text:
Career and Technical Education (CTE) is quickly becoming the hottest topic in education news throughout the United States. Teachers, administrators, and students celebrate CTE Month every year in February. In 2020, CTE Month is more popular than it’s ever been before- and for good reason!

CTE is proven to work as an educational philosophy. It helps students learn and offers a variety of educational strategies for teachers. As a result, we would like to spotlight the many CTE courses that we offer at Russell Middle School & Brunswick High School. #BrunswickStrong #CTEMonth2020

It's never easy going from "THE man" to a role player on a team but Javonte Green has taken that challenge head on this year and is doing it with a smile.

post_text:
Good evening, Due to the potential of flooded road conditions, Brunswick County Public Schools will operate on a two hour delay for all students and staff on Friday, February 7, 2020. All 12-month employees will report at 9:30 a.m. All other staff members will report at 9:45 a.m.

Attention Governor's School and Lake Country Advanced Knowledge Center students: You will not report to Governors School and Lake Country Advanced Knowledge Center. Please report to the high school. Breakfast will not be served.

We will continue to monitor road conditions and provide updates as needed.

post_text:
“Education is not the filling of a pail, but the lighting of a fire." - William Butler Yates

The month of February marks the annual observance of School Board Appreciation Month. We salute the hard work of our school board members while celebrating public education. This year’s theme for the Virginia School Boards Association is "Excellence Through Equity." We thank our board members for their service to the students, staff, parents, and the greater community of Brunswick County Public Schools. #BrunswickStrong #VSBA

post_text:
Update as of 10:56am, Friday, January 31, 2020:

This serves as a follow-up to the notification of a cellular threat that occurred at Brunswick High School on Thursday, January 30, 2020. Due to the expedient action of the Brunswick County Sheriff’s Department in collaboration with Brunswick High School administration, the issue has been mitigated and the threat has been lifted. We take matters of this nature seriously and plan to take appropriate disciplinary action will be taken.

The safety of our students is paramount and remains a constant priority. We are appreciative of the continued collaboration between Brunswick High School, the Brunswick County Sheriff’s Department, and the greater community.
text:
Update as of 10:56am, Friday, January 31, 2020:

This serves as a follow-up to the notification of a cellular threat that occurred at Brunswick High School on Thursday, January 30, 2020. Due to the expedient action of the Brunswick County Sheriff’s Department in collaboration with Brunswick High School administration, the issue has been mitigated and the threat has been lifted. We take matters of this nature seriously and plan to take appropriate disciplinary action will be taken.

The safety of our students is paramount and remains a constant priority. We are appreciative of the continued collaboration between Brunswick High School, the Brunswick County Sheriff’s Department, and the greater community.

post_text:
Update as of 3:30pm, Thursday, January 30, 2020:

At the conclusion of the school day, the lockdown was lifted. The school day ended without incident. The Brunswick County Sheriff’s Department and School Administration will continue their collaboration to investigate the matter.

As always, we aim to ensure the safety and security of our students, faculty, and staff. Parents and community, we need your assistance, as you hear anything that is of particular concern, please contact the Brunswick County Sheriff’s Department and/or administration at Brunswick High School. We thank you in advance for your continued communication and collaboration as we maintain the safety and security of our schools.

Parents and community, we need your assistance, as you hear anything that is of particular concern, please contact the Brunswick County Sheriff’s Department and/or administration at Brunswick High School. post_text: Did you know? January 19-25th is Virginia School Principals Appreciation Week. The role of the principal as the instructional leader of the school is critically important to ensure students are provided the opportunity to learn. Our principals work diligently to help students and teachers excel, and their leadership and hard work are essential to the success of our schools. #BrunswickStrong #ThankAPrincipal

Brunswick County Public Schools is currently recruiting for the following list of vacancies.

Elementary Teachers
Middle School Science Teacher
Middle School Physical Education Teacher
Special Education Teacher (Grades 9-12)
Talented and Gifted Teacher (ES-8)
Transportation Supervisor
Transportation Administrative Assistant (Open until filled)
Paraprofessionals (Open until filled)
Bus Drivers (CDL Required) (Open until filled)
Part-time Custodian (Open until filled)
Substitute Teachers (Open until filled)

text:
Brunswick County Public Schools is currently recruiting for the following list of vacancies.

Elementary Teachers
Middle School Science Teacher
Middle School Physical Education Teacher
Special Education Teacher (Grades 9-12)
Talented and Gifted Teacher (ES-8)
Transportation Supervisor
Transportation Administrative Assistant (Open until filled)
Paraprofessionals (Open until filled)
Bus Drivers (CDL Required) (Open until filled)
Part-time Custodian (Open until filled)
Substitute Teachers (Open until filled)
Substitute Custodians (Open until filled)

For more detailed information regarding these positions, please visit the "Employment Opportunities" link found on the BCPS webpage and then click on “view open positions." Internal and external applicants should apply through the "Employment Opportunities" link.

Apply here -> www.brunswickcps.org

BRUNSWICKCPS.ORG
Brunswick County Public Schools

shared_text:
Meherrin-Powellton Elementary School
December 14, 2019 at 6:47 PM ·

As we continue to celebrate the holiday, next week, we are asking students and/or staff to participate in the following activities:

Tuesday, December 17: Staff Holiday Scavenger Hunt

Wednesday, December 18: Wear your Holiday pajamas (or your favorite PJ’s). Remember, your PJ’s must be school appropriate. There will also be a Student Holiday Scavenger Hunt

Thursday, December 19: Wear your Holiday socks, and/or holiday jewelry

Friday, December 20: Wear your ugly Holiday sweater (or dress in holiday colors for the musical program). The Holiday Musical Program is scheduled for 9:45. Parents are invited!

Happy Holidays! See you on January 7, 2020!

shared_text:
Brunswick High School
December 4, 2019 at 10:08 PM ·

Congratulations to our Scholastic Bowl team! They defeated Franklin High School yesterday. Shout outs to Dean Evans who did an outstanding job reading all the questions, Mrs. Lynch who attentively presided as a judge, and team sponsor Mrs. Barner-Jones for fostering such a pleasant atmosphere for our visitors. Both teams should be commended for displaying great sportsmanship throughout the competition.

shared_text:
Brunswick High School is at Brunswick High School (Virginia).
November 18, 2019 at 12:13 PM · Lawrenceville, VA ·

Happy Virginia College Application Week!

We have a week full of fun and informative activities planned!

Monday- College BINGO Activity

Tuesday- FASFA Night 5:30-6:30 in Computer Lab 322

Wednesday- College Trivia in the cafeteria

Thursday- Q&A session in the cafeteria

Friday- Students are encouraged to wear the colors of their favorite college or university or of an institution of an older sibling, parent, or relative.
For additional fun, we are having a contest for the most creative college-themed outfit. Students who participate should plan to wear their outfit all day —so make sure it is comfortable and will not distract from their learning.

Teachers and staff should wear their favorite college paraphernalia.

Congratulations to Tydia Hawkins. She’s the College BINGO winner! Tydia Hawkins plans to pursue a nursing career through Southside Virginia Community College-Alberta site!
#IappliedVA
#VCAW

A special THANK YOU to Mr. Simmons and all other veterans for your dedication and commitment to our country. #WeChooseBetter #BeyondtheChalkboard

November 4, 2019 at 10:34 AM ·

BHS Seniors recently spent the day at SVCC-Alberta site, interacting with SVCC staff, faculty, and ambassadors as they learned all about college life during the annual College For A Day event. Students were exposed to various career opportunities in the fields of nursing, science, criminal justice, technology, and business. SVCC also shared information on financial aid, scholarships, and being a successful college student. Thank you SVCC for an amazing day of real world learning!

post_text: BHS Takes A Stand Against Bullying: October is National Bullying Prevention Awareness Month. The campaign is held during the month of October and unites communities around the world to educate and raise awareness of bullying prevention. Videographer & Sophomore student, Jecori Evans, reached out to many of his classmates and peers to create this video. His vision was to bring awareness to the pressures that many students may face with bullying. Kudos to the Jecori, the BHS students, the PBL class, and Mr. LD Swann on a job well done. #StopBullying #StandTogether #BrunswickStrong

Totaro Elementary School
October 21, 2019 at 9:59 AM ·

Totaro Elementary surprised all their students with a "Smarty Pants" Awards Ceremony. In grades Pre-K-2, three students from each class were awarded certificates and blue ribbons for numerous achievements. In grades 3-5, students were awarded certiificates for proficiency or growth on their reading and math benchmarks. Students with at least 90% proficiency received medals and perfect scores received trophies. We are extremely proud of our students as #WeCHOOSEBetter

post_text: ALUMNI News: Mr. Herbert Brown currently serves as not only the Marketing Manager of family-owned Browntown Farms, but also serves as the County Executive Director for the Farm Service Agency of the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA). In his role at Browntown Farms, his duties include planning, planting, harvesting, and marketing crops. He also handles the business aspects of the farm. This operation is run by both Herbert and his father. In his USDA role, he administers farm programs to local farmers and landowners. He implements policies that help farmers in times of need. Herbert is a 2006 graduate of Brunswick High School and a 2009 graduate of Virginia State University. #BrunswickStrong #ENTREPRENEUR #AlumniSaturday

shared_text:
Meherrin-Powellton Elementary School
October 19, 2019 at 9:19 AM ·

People often associate office referrals with student misbehavior. At Meherrin-Powellton, we believe office referrals can be written for positive student behavior! So, Positive Behavior Referrals are submitted for students who exhibit positive behaviors such as scholarship, citizenship, and leadership! Students receive a copy of their referral with a personalized note from the principal. The students’ names as well as their positive behaviors are also celebrated over the intercom! Let’s continue to celebrate this week’s outstanding students! More greatness next week....

Congratulations!! 💪🏽💙 #BrunswickStrong

post_text: Mrs. Krystle Pearson, Director of Technology, shared a virtual reality presentation with the Brunswick County Board of Supervisors on Thursday, October 17, 2019. Members of the board and those is attendance traveled to Australia, Mexico, Indonesia, and Ecuador in less than 7 minutes. Our students are currently using these digital technology resources to travel the world from the comfort of the classroom. #BrunswickStrong ￼

post_text:
Dear Brunswick County Families,

This notification is in reference to report card distribution. Originally, report cards were to be distributed on Friday, October 18, 2019. Unfortunately, the PowerSchool Student Information System (SIS) was delayed in creating our report cards in their system and we are still experiencing some issues. As a result, our schools will send their report cards home next Wednesday, October 23, 2019. We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused. We appreciate your patience as we navigate through this process. Should you have additional questions and/or concerns, please contact your child's school.
text:
Dear Brunswick County Families,

This notification is in reference to report card distribution. Originally, report cards were to be distributed on Friday, October 18, 2019. Unfortunately, the PowerSchool Student Information System (SIS) was delayed in creating our report cards in their system and we are still experiencing some issues. As a result, our schools will send their report cards home next Wednesday, October 23, 2019. We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused. We appreciate your patience as we navigate through this process. Should you have additional questions and/or concerns, please contact your child's school.

post_text: JUST IN CASE YOU MISSED IT: The Brunswick High School Chapter of FBLA attended a Fall Conference at Longwood last Thursday. They had the pleasure of having the Russell Middle School students who are interested in starting a chapter join them. Kudos to Dr. Singleton, Mr. Chatlin, Mrs. Jarrett and Ms Davis for chaperoning. The students said that it was a successful and informative day. The students also had a surprise visit from the former FBLA President, Breanna Smith who is now a student at Longwood. #BrunswickStrong #BHSBulldogs

post_text: Did someone say scholarships? Congratulations to our BHS students on receiving over $800,000 in scholarship awards. That my friends is the epitome of being #BrunswickStrong. 💙💪🏽 Kudos to the teachers and administrators for making this possible.
shared_text:
Brunswick High School
October 5, 2019 at 11:38 PM ·

A total of 38 students participated in the 13th Annual Infinite Scholars College Application and Scholarship Fair today. Many of our students received on site admission to various colleges and universities and received a combined total of over $800,000 in scholarship awards. Simply amazing!! They are #BrunswickMade and #BrunswickStrong So proud of them!! A special thank you to Phyllis Walker for all that you do for the students in Brunswick!
